fieldData.title: Trade unions call for aerospace recovery plan
fieldData.calc_minorCategory: Supporting businesses to get back to normal
fieldData.calc_subMinorCategory: Measures to support a gradual relaunch of work
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: The global COVID-19 pandemic has had a devastating impact on the aerospace sector, most notably in civil aeronautics. The collapse of commercial flights, resulted in airlines cancelling or postponing new orders leading to disastrous effects on the European manufacturing sector. These included a huge reduction in demand, production cuts, transport restrictions, supply problems, delays, cash-flow problems and the stoppage of some ‘’noncritical’’ work. On 16 October 2020 the European Trade Union IndustriAll representing, i.a. employees of this sector called for European solutions to rescue it presenting aerospace recovery plan ‘Flying into recovery’.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: IndustriAll Europe stress that the European aerospace industry has long been a brilliant example of a truly European industrial project with a high-tech value chain spread right across Europe. Member States are currently scrambling for national solutions, forgetting the sector's European dimension that requires a European solution. European federation  is calling for urgent action at European level and the immediate creation of a European Task Force which will implement European solutions to protect the sector and safeguard thousands of high-quality jobs throughout Europe.IndustriAll Europe calls on EU policy makers to adopt an ambitious industrial recovery plan post COVID-19 that pays due attention to the needs of the aerospace sector and restores the capacity of the sector to generate the cashflows needed to invest in a sustainable future.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: The plan is to maintain 600,000 jobs.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: An independent initiative of the European Trade Union IndustriAll.
